actions.text: Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Interior and Insular Affairs. H. Rept. 102-682, Part I.

Referred sequentially to the House Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries for a period ending not later than July 28, 1992 for consideration of such provisions of the bill and amendment as fall within the jurisdiction of that committee pursuant to clause 1(n) of rule X.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Ordered to be Reported (Amended) by Voice Vote.
Reported (Amended) by the Committee on Merchant Marine and Fisheries. H. Rept. 102-682, Part II.
Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 405.
Mr. Miller (CA) moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate.
On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill, as amended Agreed to by voice vote.
Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

Subcommittee on Public Lands, National Parks and Forests

official_title: To designate wilderness, acquire certain valuable inholdings within National Wildlife Refuges and National Park System Units, and for other purposes.
short_title: Alaska Peninsula Wilderness Designation Act of 1992

summary.text: Alaska Peninsula Wilderness Designation Act of 1992 - Designates the following lands in Alaska as components of the National Wilderness Preservation System: (1) the Aniakchak Wilderness within the Aniakchak National Monument and Preserve; (2) the Alaska Peninsula Wilderness within the Alaska Peninsula National Wildlife Refuge; and (3) specified lands within the Becharof National Wildlife Refuge as an addition to the Becharof Wilderness. Authorizes the renewal or reissuance of any special use or concession permit which was in existence in 1991 to the same permittee for operations on such lands designated as wilderness, subject to specified conditions. Provides for the relinquishment of Koniag, Inc., Selection Rights (oil and gas rights) to specified lands in Alaska in exchange for the Secretary of the Treasury establishing a Koniag Account in equal value to the Selection Rights which shall be available to Koniag for bidding on and purchasing Federal property (wherever located) sold at any public sale by an agency. Limits the average value per acre of the Selection Rights to a maximum of $300.
